activities.loc: Branch 3 - Hearing by Zoom.  See enclosed information.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Request for Plea Hearing via Zoom
Scheduling Order
Status conference on December 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 9:48 AM 
Defendant Ignacio Mendez appeared by zoom.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez appeared by zoom for Ignacio Mendez.  Attorney Jeffrey Shock appears via zoom and in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews the court record. 

Atty Martinez indicates resolution will be reached; requests status after 12/9/22 to allow receipt of Waukesha Co blood test results. 

Scheduling is discussed.

recess: 9:54am 
NEXT: Status on 12/15/22 at 9:00am via zoom
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 9:55AM
Defendant Ignacio Mendez in court with Attorney Nicholas Martinez. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This file is scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing, however the Defense advises that this hearing will be a waiver.

The Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered as to both Counts
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

Att Martinez requests that another Status Conference be scheduled, and that both he and the Defendant be allowed to appear by Zoom.

recess 10:00AM

NEXT:  Status Conference on 10/17 at 9:30AM via Zoom

Pre-trial conference on July 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia

[ae] case called 10:36 AM Defendant Ignacio Mendez in court. Attorney Nicholas Martinez appeared by telephone. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct and provides updated address. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to Counsel given
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription; to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia

recess 10:45 am
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/27/22 at 9:00 am  (2) Preliminary Hearing on 8/18/22 at 9:30 am
